Check panel feasibility

Source: R/iSEE-extras.R
INTERNAL_check_plot_feasibility.Rd

Check which panel types are feasible and which ones cannot be generated with the information available in a SingleCellExperiment object.

.check_plot_feasibility(se)

Arguments

se

A SingleCellExperiment object.

Value

A list of named logical scalars, where each entry corresponds to an encoded panel type (e.g., "redDimPlot") and specifies whether that panel type can be generated.

Details

While all panel types could be generated, it doesn't make sense to do so in some cases:

  • Reduced dimension plots will not be generated if there are no results in reducedDims(se), or no samples.

  • Column data plots will not be generated if there are no column metadata in colData(se), or no samples.

  • Feature assay plots will not be generated if there are no samples, no features or no assays.

  • Row statistics tables will not be generated if there are no features.

  • Row data plots will not be generated if there are no row metdata in rowData(se) or no features.

  • Sample assay plots will not be generated if there are no samples, no features or no assays.

  • Custom data plots will not be generated if there are no samples and no features, or if no custom functions are available in the internal metadata of se.

  • Heatmaps will not be generated if there are no samples, no features or no assays.

If a panel type is infeasible, users will not be able to initialize or add any panels of that type. This is probably the safest course of action by avoiding the need to write error handling code in the panel functions themselves.

See also

.panel_generation, iSEE
